lexUnit.name: far.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not within a certain distance (of).

sentence.text: A hound spoke at the far end of the wood .
He went to the far side of the classroom .
Silk guarded the far door .
Auguste pointed towards the golden edifice at the far end of the gardens .
A theatrical poster , protected by glass , was displayed in the far corner of the room .
Away to the south-west , on the far bank of the river , standing up on the desert bluffs , we could see the Pyramids of Giza , shimmering through the haze above the city .
Early that January a bitter wind blowing off the far Urals seized East Anglia in a grip of ice .
She finally came to a halt at the very far end of the garden .
One may think such a suggestion to be far from orthodox .
But even here there were signs that we were not far from the sea or from strange phenomena .
I did not live far from the school so it did not take long to get there .
Her room was not far from Tom 's and on the same side of the house , but she could not remember hearing birds before .
At least her horrible outfit fitted her , and though it was far from being a party dress , let alone the dress of her dreams , it was reasonable , unlike Eve 's .
It was immediately apparent that although it was an improvement in principle , the device was far from being a success .
Only the solidity of the flesh she touched was very far from being imaginary .
The organism was in fact far from being healthy .
Far from bringing an end to worry , home ownership became a struggle to stay in the place called home .
Far from engineering the union , as has been widely suspected , her grandmother advised her about the difficulties of marrying into the royal family .
Far from feeling elated or having adrenaline surging about , I was frightened , shattered , but also bewildered .
` Oh , " Gioella said dismissively , ` just someone from the far past .
Such a dream , if it is realisable at all , is certainly one for the far future .
I am somewhat far from the stage , but it was the best seat I could get at such short notice . "
All at once , from quite far out on the water , there came an outburst of noise -- frightened shouts , and a sound as if someone had fallen in .
I 'd repeat my name -- and as I got really far from shore I 'd say ` Ng " or ` Adolph " -- to try to bring me back inside myself .
The open-windowed room looked as if it was quite far away from the main body of the Workshops .
